conclusion: Liquid will flow out from points A, B, C, and D and reach containers E and F after passing through obstacles.
Point A is located at the top left, point B is next to A, point C is next to B, and point D is at the top right.
Container E is located at the bottom left, and container F is located at the bottom right.
There are four obstacles: a pink slanted baffle near point B, a green slanted barrier near point C, a blue baffle near the merged streams of B and C, and a white slanted barrier near point D.

premise: Stream A drops straight down without meeting any obstacle.
conclusion: Liquid from A flows directly into container E.

premise: Stream B hits the pink slanted baffle and is deflected to the left.
conclusion: Liquid from B flows into container E.

premise: Stream C strikes the green slanted barrier and is deflected to the left.
conclusion: Liquid from C merges with liquid from B.

premise: Streams B and C merge and encounter the blue baffle, which deflects them to the right.
conclusion: Merged streams of B and C flow into container F.

premise: Stream D flows along the white slanted barrier and turns right.
conclusion: Liquid from D flows into container F.

premise: Liquid from A flows directly into container E, liquid from B partially flows into container E, and the merged streams of B and C flow into container F along with liquid from D.
conclusion: Most liquid from A and little liquid from B end in container E; the other liquid from B, C, and D reach container F.
